## BaseTypeImpl.withBrand() method

Create a new instance of this Type with the given name.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
withBrand<BrandName extends string>(name: BrandName): TypeImpl<BaseTypeImpl<Branded<ResultType, BrandName>>>;
```

## Parameters

| Parameter | Type      | Description                           |
| --------- | --------- | ------------------------------------- |
| name      | BrandName | the new name to use in error messages |

<b>Returns:</b>

[TypeImpl](./types.typeimpl.md)<!-- -->&lt;[BaseTypeImpl](./types.basetypeimpl.md)<!-- -->&lt;[Branded](./types.branded.md)<!-- -->&lt;ResultType, BrandName&gt;&gt;&gt;

## Remarks

Creates a brand. By creating a branded type, we ensure that TypeScript will consider this a seperate type, see [Branded](./types.branded.md) for more information.
